p: Statistical analyses (ANOVA, post-hoc test) were performed using Statistica 13 (StatSoft, Inc., Tulsa, OK, USA). The number of repetitions ( n) for a particular measurement and information about what constitutes a repetition is provided in the description of a particular analytical method. In the case of tocopherol content ( Figure 1, Figures S1, S2 and S3) and antioxidant activity ( Figure 2) for a particular oil, the Duncan’s test ( p ≤ 0.05) was used to compare mean values for each herb treatment (sage, basil, thyme) separately. In the case of chemical composition of oil cakes ( Figure 3) [fibre, β-carotene, total tocopherols (including particular tocopherols— Figure S4), vitamin C, lutein] and antioxidant activity of oil cakes, mean values obtained for all eight tested oil cakes were compared using the Duncan’s test ( p ≤ 0.05). Mean values in Figure 1, Figure 2 and Figure 3 and Figures S1–S4 are provided with standard deviation (±SD). Brief information about the statistical approach is included in the descriptions of all the figures.
